info.title: Outlocks™ Access Management API
info.description:
---
# General Information

This document describes the REST APIs for integrating with Outlocks™ Access Management System (OAMS) and its core functionalities. The OAMS consists of two main systems: Wi-Key Bluetooth low-energy (BLE) and Knock Code Technology (KCT)

The Wi-Key management system consists of these main entities: Locks, Users and Work orders. Based on these entities, access definitions may be configured and changed. Locks represent the actual locking device that is installed in the field and needs to be accessed (unlocked). An individual lock is identified in the system by it's unique attributes - Log number and Product key. A User represents the individual who needs access to the locks, and holds information required for operations such as the username, password and smartphone device that is used for access. Work orders are the specific definitions of the access and include attributes such as Dates, Times, Geofencing etc. The work orders are linked to the Locks and the Users to define for a group of individuals what locks they may access under what specific set of rules defined in the work order.

The Knock Code technology access management system consists of these main elements: Locking units, Key holders and KnocKeys. Based on these entities, access definitions may be configured and edited. A locking unit represents the actual device that is installed in the field and needs to be accessed (unlocked). An individual lock is identified in the system by its unique attribute - Log number. A Key Holder represents the person who has access to this lock and holds required information such as his mobile number for the purpose of requesting codes and other details. A KnocKey represents the device used to transmit codes to the lock, and it is identified by its unique identifier - the serial number. In addition to these three elements, an access definition will contain information about the access code used - type of the code, schedule of use and the code itself. When using Service Codes in the access definition, the access management system allows dynamic control of the service code issuance by geolocation and scheduling: recurring time windows (days of the weeks and hours of the day) in which a service code may be issued, or Work orders - specific dates and times in which a service code may be issued.   

Portal Users represent inividuals who perform API work that is more administrative in nature, and they are in charge of defining & updating other entities in the OAMS like Users, Locks, Sites & Work orders that govern the access provided to other users.

All APIs are exposed over a secured HTTPS channel.

---
# API Use Flow

In order to use most of the API's endpoints, an valid access token is required. 

A token can be acquired using the `/identity/tokens` endpoint.

The token management complies with the JWT open standard. Means that when sending a request to an endpoint that requires a token, the **request header** must include:

`"Authorization":"Bearer <Actual token id>"`

---
# Currently Available Endpoints

  # 1. Identity
  
  - POST `/identity/tokens` (since 1.0.0) - Get token for API requests
  - POST `/identity/verifyCode` (since 1.0.2) - verify code recieved during multifactor authentication
  - DELETE `/identity/tokens/{tokenId}` (since 1.1.0) - Request Token invalidation
  - POST `/identity/secureChannel` (since 1.1.0) - Establishes Secure channel between SDK & Server

  
  # 2. Locks
  
  - POST `/locks` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new Lock
  - PUT `/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a Lock object
  - GET `/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Get extended information about a single Lock
  - POST `/locks/get` (since 1.0.0) - Get locks information
  - DELETE `/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing Lock
  - PUT `/locks/{logNumber}/links/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Link Groups to a Lock
  - DELETE `/locks/{logNumber}/links/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Group from a Lock
  - PUT `/locks/{logNumber}/links/sites` (since 1.0.2) - Link Sites to a Lock
  - DELETE `/locks/{logNumber}/links/sites/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Site from a Lock
  - PUT `/locks/{logNumber}/links/workOrders` (since 1.0.2) - Link Work orders to a Lock
  - DELETE `/locks/{logNumber}/links/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Work order from a Lock
  
  # 3. Work Orders
  
  - POST `/workOrders` (since 1.0.2)  - Create a new Work order
  - PUT `/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a Work order
  - DELETE `/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing Work order
  - GET `/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Request information about a specific Work order
  - POST `/workOrders/get` (since 1.0.2) - Request information about Work orders
  - PUT `/workOrders/{name}/links/locks` (since 1.0.2) - Link Locks to a Work order
  - DELETE `/workOrders/{name}/links/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a lock from a Work order
  - PUT `/workOrders/{name}/links/users` (since 1.0.2) - Link Users to a Work order
  - DELETE `/workOrders/{name}/links/users/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a User from a Work order
  - PUT `/workOrders/{name}/links/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Link Groups to a Work order
  - DELETE `/workOrders/{name}/links/groups/{groupName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Group from a Work order
  - PUT `/workOrders/{name}/links/sites` (since 1.0.2) - Link Sites to a Work order
  - DELETE `/workOrders/{name}/links/sites/{siteName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Site from a Work order
  - POST `/kct/workOrders` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new KCT Work order
  - PUT `/kct/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a KCT Work order
  - DELETE `/kct/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.1.0) - Delete an existing Work order
  - GET `/kct/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.1.0) - Get a Work order object's information
  - POST `/kct/workOrders/get` (since 1.0.2) - Request KCT Work orders meta-data
  - PUT `/kct/workOrders/{name}/links/locks` (since 1.0.2) - Link Locks to a KCT Work order
  - DELETE `/kct/workOrders/{name}/links/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a lock from a KCT Work order
  - PUT `/kct/workOrders/{name}/links/keyHolders` (since 1.0.2) - Link Key Holders to a KCT Work order
  - DELETE `/kct/workOrders/{name}/links/keyHolders/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a key holder from a KCT Work order
  
  # 4. Groups
  
  - POST `/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a Group object
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing group
  - GET `/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Get a Group object's information
  - POST `/groups/get` (since 1.0.2) - Request Groups meta-data
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/locks` (since 1.0.2) - Link Locks to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Lock from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/users` (since 1.0.2) - Link Users to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/users/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a User from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/sites` (since 1.0.2) - Link Sites to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/sites/{siteName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Site from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/kctLocks` (since 1.0.2) - Link KCT Locks to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/kctLocks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a KCT Lock from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/clusters` (since 1.0.2) - Link Clusters to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/clusters/{clusterName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Cluster from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/keyHolders` (since 1.0.2) - Link Key holders to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/keyHolders/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Key holder from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/kctKeys` (since 1.0.2) - Link KCT Keys to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/kctKeys/{serialNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a KCT Key from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/workOrders` (since 1.0.2) - Link Work orders to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/workOrders/{workOrderName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Work order from a Group
  - PUT `/groups/{name}/links/portalUsers` (since 1.0.2) - Link Portal Users to a Group
  - DELETE `/groups/{name}/links/portalUsers/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Portal User from a Group
  
  # 5. Users
  
  - POST `/users` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new User
  - PUT `/users/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a User object
  - DELETE `/users/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing user
  - GET `/users/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Get a User object's information
  - POST `/users/get` (since 1.0.2) - Request Users meta-data
  - PUT `/users/{username}/links/workOrders` (since 1.0.2) - Link work orders to a User
  - DELETE `/users/{username}/links/workOrders/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a work order from a User
  - PUT `/users/{username}/links/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Link groups to a User
  - DELETE `/users/{username}/links/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Group from a User
  - PUT `/users/{username}/links/accountToAuth` (since 1.0.2) - Link an Account to authorize to a User
  - DELETE `/users/{username}/links/accountToAuth/{ataUsername}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink an account to auth from a User
  - PUT `/users/{username}/links/supervisorAccounts` (since 1.0.2) - Link Supervisor Accounts to a User
  - DELETE `/users/{username}/links/supervisorAccounts/{saUsername}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a supervisor account from a User
  - PUT `/users/{username}/resetPassword` (since 1.3.0.9) - reset the password of a user
  
  # 6. Portal Users
  
  - POST `/portalUsers` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new Portal User
  - PUT `/portalUsers/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a Portal User object
  - DELETE `/portalUsers/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing user
  - GET `/portalUsers/{username}` (since 1.0.2) - Get a Portal User object's information
  - POST `/portalUsers/get` (since 1.0.2) - Request Portal Users meta-data
  - PUT `/portalUsers/{username}/links/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Link groups to a Portal User
  - DELETE `/portalUsers/{username}/links/groups/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Group from a Portal User
  - PUT `/portalUsers/{username}/resetPassword` (since 1.3.0.9) - reset the password of a portal user
  
  # 7. Sites
  
  - POST `/sites` (since 1.0.2) - Create a new Site
  - PUT `/sites/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Modify a Site object
  - DELETE `/sites/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Delete an existing Site
  - GET `/sites/{name}` (since 1.0.2) - Get a Site object's information
  - POST `/sites/get` (since 1.0.2) - Get sites information
  - PUT `/sites/{name}/links/groups` (since 1.0.2) - Link groups to a Site
  - DELETE `/sites/{name}/links/groups/{groupName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Group from a Site
  - PUT `/sites/{name}/links/locks` (since 1.0.2) - Link Locks to a Site
  - DELETE `/sites/{name}/links/locks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a Lock from a Site
  - PUT `/sites/{name}/links/kctLocks` (since 1.0.2) - Link KCT Locks to a Site
  - DELETE `/sites/{name}/links/kctLocks/{logNumber}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a KCT Lock from a Site
  - PUT `/sites/{name}/links/workOrders` (since 1.0.2) - Link work orders to a Site
  - DELETE `/sites/{name}/links/workOrders/{workOrderName}` (since 1.0.2) - Unlink a work order from a Site
  
  # 8. Access Keys
  
  - POST `/access/accessKeys` (since 1.0.0) - Request new Access Keys from the server
    
  # 9. Events
  
  - POST `/events` (since 1.1.0) - Send information about events to the server
  - GET  `/events/{eventId}` (since 1.1.0) - Request information about a specific event from the server
  - POST `/events/get` (since 1.1.4) - Get information about events from the server

---
# HTTP Codes

HTTP response status codes indicate whether a specific HTTP request has been successfully completed. We will employ 3 code groups: successful responses, client errors and servers errors. Status codes are defined by section 10 of RFC 2616.

**Successful response:**
- **`200` - OK**. The request has succeeded. The meaning of a success varies depending on the endpoint. The resource describing the result of the action is transmitted in the message body.
- **`204` - No Content**. This response will return if a DELETE type request was completed successfully.

**Client error responses:**
- **`400` - Bad Request**. This response means that the server could not understand the request due to invalid input. According to the endpoint in question, the response body may hold an error object with additional data (see section below)

- **`401` - Unauthorized**. Although the HTTP standard specifies "unauthorized", semantically this response means "unauthenticated". That is, the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

- **`404` - Not Found**. The server can not find requested resource. 

**Server error responses:**

- **`500` - Internal Server Error**. The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle.

- **`503` - Service Unavailable**. The server is not ready to handle the request. Common causes are a server that is down for maintenance or that is overloaded. 
---

# Error Response Object

For some of the response error you may get from the API, the reponse body will contain an error object with the following structure:
```
{
  "AppStatusCode": "string",
  "Message": "string",
  "Reason": "string"
}
```
`appStatusCode` will contain a string constant from the list provided in the HTTP codes section above. `message` and `reason` may contain forther information about the error that occured. 

Here is an example of an error object you may get if you request an access key for a lock that belongs to multiple sites without providing a site id in the request:

The HTTP status code will be `400` - Bad request, and the response body will be:

```
{
  "AppStatusCode": "MISSING_SITE_ID",
  "Message": "Site ID must be provided for lock: '718A900002' in order to request an access key",
  "Reason": "Lock is linked to multiple sites: ee83eaef-1b04-484f-9b83-d9b70d22c533, edee45c4-12e2-4921-bde6-a18219257570"
}
```
---

post.description: Sends a request for login with the provided identification credentials. If the server determines that this user needs to perform multifactor authentification, it will send a SMS to the user's phone number with a verification code. if the user does not require MFA, the response will hold the data needed to login the user and some information about this user.

parameters.name: WK-APP-VERSION
parameters.description: __Optional__ - The application version that calls to this API endpoint

parameters.name: WK-DEVICE-INFO
parameters.description: __Optional__ - The mobile device model that calls to this API endpoint

parameters.name: WK-OS-VERSION
parameters.description: __Optional__ - The mobile device OS that calls to this API endpoint

parameters.name: WK-OS-BUILD
parameters.description: __Optional__ - The mobile device OS Build that calls to this API endpoint

delete.summary: Request Token invalidation
delete.description: Provide the ID of a token you want to logout / invalidate. If successfull this token will become invalid and no longer be able to authorize any api requests

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The Id of the token you want to invalidate

post.summary: Verify sent code as part of Multifactor Authentication
post.description: Attempts to verify the code sent by the server through SMS as part of MFA process

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: Provides required information about a mobile user's phone's operating system. Valid values are: "Android" or "iOS".

post.summary: Establishes Secure channel between SDK & Server
post.description: Establishes Secure channel between SDK and Server using public key exchange
Provide the required information for creating a new Lock

put.summary: Modify a Lock object
put.description: Provide information you would like to update in an existing Lock.

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the lock you want to Modify

get.summary: Get extended information about a single Lock
get.description: Request information about a specific Lock

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the lock you want information about

parameters.name: includeLinks
parameters.description: Indicates if you want information about objects linked to this lock

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: You need to provide a timezone name (using IANA format) so that the validity limit datetimes can be adjusted to local time where the request originated.Example value: "America/Detroit" or "Canada/Pacific".

delete.summary: Delete an existing Lock
delete.description: Request the deletion of an existing Lock object

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the lock you want to delete

post.description: Request information about locks from the server. The response will contain an array of locks according to the requesting user and the parameters provided in the request.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Determines the maximum amount of locks returned in one response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset from the results list's beginning

parameters.name: sortCriteria
parameters.description: Determines the parameter the results will be sorted by. Currently supported values are - "Distance" (sorts from closest to furthest, must supply location parameter, distance is measured according to linked site location), "Name" (sorts alphabetically according to lock name) & "WorkOrderStart" (sorts according to the start of the validity window of the linked work order)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: If you provide the latitude and longitude of your current location, the locks list in the response will be ordered from closest to furthest from that location. Example value: "32.5467,25.4897" ("Latitude,Longitude").

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: You need to provide a timezone name (using IANA format) so that the validity limit datetimes can be adjusted to local time where the request originated.Example value: "America/Detroit" or "Canada/Pacific".

put.summary: Link Groups to a Lock
put.description: The path parameter log number indicates the lock to which you want to link, and the request body contains an array of the names of the groups you wish to link. The returned object includes updated values for all the properties.

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the lock you want to link to

delete.summary: Unlink a Group from a Lock
delete.description: Request the unlinking of a Group from the lock indicated by the log number path parameter.

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the Lock

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Group you want to unlink from the lock

put.summary: Link Sites to a Lock
put.description: The path parameter log number indicates the lock to which you want to link, and the request body contains an array of the names of the sites you wish to link. The returned object includes updated values for all the properties.

parameters.description: The log number of the lock you want to link to

delete.summary: Unlink a Site from a Lock

parameters.name: logNumber
parameters.description: The log number of the Lock

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Site you want to unlink from the lock

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Work order you want to unlink from the lock

post.description: Provide the required information for creating a new work order. If successful, the response body will contain the new WO.
Provide filter criteria for the work orders you would like to get information about.

put.summary: Modify a Work order
put.description: The request should define a single Work Order object to update, and new values for properties. The Work Order is defined by its Name. The returned object includes updated values for all the properties.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Work order you want to modify

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: includeLinks
parameters.description: Indicates if you want information about objects linked to this work order

post.description: Provide the required information for creating a new Site

Request information about sites from the server. The response will contain an array of sites objects. The sites will hold lock identifiers for locks the calling user has work orders for. The request body can hold several optional values for filtering the returned site list

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Determines the maximum amount of sites returned in one response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset from the results list's beginning

parameters.name: sortCriteria
parameters.description: Determines the parameter the results will be sorted by. Currently supported values are - "Distance" (sorts from closest to furthest, must supply location parameter, distance is measured according to linked site location), "Name" (sorts alphabetically according to site name) & "WorkOrderStart" (sorts according to the start of the validity window of the linked work order)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: If you provide latitude and longitude of your current location, the sites list in the response will be ordered from closest to furthest from that location. If no value is provided - the list will be ordered according to lock name alphabetically.example value - "32.5467,25.4897"

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: You need to provide a timezone name (using IANA format) so that the validity limit datetimes can be adjusted to local time where the request originated.Example value: "America/Detroit" or "Canada/Pacific".

put.description: Provide information you would like to update in an existing Site's meta-data.

post.summary: Create a new KCT Work order
post.description: Provide the required information for creating a new KCT work order. If successful, the response body will contain a description of the new KCT WO.

put.summary: Modify a KCT Work order
put.description: The request should define a single Work Order object to update, and the new value for each property. The Work Order is defined by its Name. The returned object includes updated values for all the properties.

parameters.description: The name of the KCT Work order you want to modify

post.description: Provide filter criteria for the KCT work orders you would like to get information about. Currently data about the member objects of a work order is not available

post.summary: Request new Access Keys from the server
post.description: Creates one or more access key/s according to provided info. The response will contain all the data required for communicating with and operate an Outlocks™ lock.

4XX.description:
400 - MISSING_PARAMETER
 
400 - MISSING_SITE_ID

400 - DEVICE_NOT_LINKED_TO_SITE

400 - DEVICE_NOT_LINKED_TO_WORKORDER

400 - FW_DATA_NOT_FOUND_FOR_LOCK

403 - FORBIDDEN

post.summary: Send information about events to the server
post.description: Provide information needed for reporting events from the mobile app or locks so that they can be added to the event log or audit trails in the server.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Identifier for the sender of the request

get.summary: Request information about a specific event from the server
get.description: Provide the id of an event you want information on from the server's events log.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Identifier for the event you are requesting

post.summary: Request information about events from the server
post.description: Provide request containg filters, sorting & pagination parameters to get a list of events from the server's events log.

ErrorResponse.description: This is a generic API error reponse. Note that Message and Reason properties are optional.

Authorization.description: Use of this endpoint requires the token provided upon login
